sub_title: Programme Manager at Human Security Collective | Anthropologist | Ph.D
summary:
Researcher and development professional with a PhD in anthropology and extensive experience in academia, applied research, and civil society. I am currently working as a programme manager at Human Security Collective in The Hague, with a focus on human rights and prevention of violent extremism in Northern Cameroon and elsewhere.

Professional interests and expertise:  Human Security | Preventing Violent Extremism | Youth | Religion | Migration | Sport | Ethnographic research | Visual methods

[{'company': {'id': 17954518, 'name': 'Human Security Collective', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQHhpAM9j_r8Wg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519880803965?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=Jz-ToVG-c9H9yhUabGHO2kYNKHgZpB23ENyQzhZ1_4s', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/human-security-collective/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague, Netherlands &  Maroua, Cameroon', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Human Security Collective', 'description': "Human Security Collective is a foundation working on issues of development, security and the involvement of citizens in their communities and societies. 

Based on the elements of trust-creation, local ownership, empowerment and collective action, we facilitate conversation between civil society, policymakers, and security actors to promote alternative approaches to current security practice.

Key projects I'm involved with currently are located primarily in the Far North region of Cameroon, where I work with civil society organizations and local communities to build resilience and ensure human rights. I also work with students in the Dutch higher education system around action research, rights, and human security.", 'title': 'Programme Manager', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 875200, 'name': 'Tricycle Europe', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQEiNxWjQezrmw/company-logo_400_400/0/1688480480238?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=Tw10tPKaw-UjBGDqn4CLmr5EZ9CPCbDGOOLcXlcg1KU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tricycle-europe/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Tricycle Europe', 'description': 'Set up, managed, and analyzed coaching programmes in the field of digital sales and marketing.', 'title': 'Programme Coordinator', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 4881, 'name': 'UNICEF', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQE5WFsvU5iicw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856174357?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=wv1Nid09MpsBciWzz6p9fKkTtwXG7NiyQ_Wegdl7y1M', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/unicef/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rio de Janeiro, Brazil & Dakar, Senegal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'UNICEF', 'description': "Planned and undertook research on child protection in the Brazilian and Senegalese football industries as part of a UNICEF project implemented by the University of Loughborough, together with an international team of experts.

The project included fieldwork in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and Dakar, Senegal, where I conducted interviews and ethnography at professional top division football clubs. Findings were then summarized and analysed in a report including policy recommendations for best practice in child protection within the global football industry.

The research led to the publication of a guide for professional clubs on the protection and realization of children's rights.", 'title': 'Research Consultant', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 4081, 'name': 'University of Amsterdam', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEfHBj_we-_kw/company-logo_400_400/0/1659945104460?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=k8egLWP3eIqIloLFULSmlLPZQR7cvpzTKHpzgtnWaBI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/university-of-amsterdam/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam,  Netherlands & Dakar, Senegal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'University of Amsterdam', 'description': 'Successfully completed my Ph.D in Anthropology at the University of Amsterdam as part of the programme group Globalizing Culture and the Quest for Belonging. The doctorate was part of the GLOBALSPORT project supported by the European Research Council (ERC).

The Ph.D project explored football, wrestling, and aspirations of migration among young men in Senegal. During the project, I spent one year in Senegal conducting in-depth ethnographic fieldwork with athletes and sports associations, published my research in relevant journals and online media, and presented at  major international conferences.
